Class TileEntityBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.CapabilityProvider<net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity>
      • net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity
        • io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.mod.registration.TileEntityBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilityProvider, net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilitySerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundNBT>, net.minecraftforge.common.extensions.IForgeTileEntity, net.minecraftforge.common.util.INBTSerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundNBT>

    public class TileEntityBase
extends net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity
    A base class for tile entities. This provides some useful methods for tile entities.

      void markDispatchable()
      This will update the tile entity to all clients that are tracking it when called on the server using NetworkImpl.updateTE(World, BlockPos) at the end of this tick.
      void onLoad()
      This will update the tile entity when on the client using NetworkImpl.requestTE(World, BlockPos).

        public TileEntityBase(net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntityType<?> tileEntityTypeIn,
                      net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.Capability<?>... caps)
        This constructor accepts some capabilities that this tile entity will have. Just make sure that the class also implements the required capability types or you might crash the game.
